activity.invalidHelpText: Invalid records can be downloaded via the context menu

detail.helpTextFailedRecords: Failed records can be downloaded, edited and re-imported.

result.activityDescription: The following entities were affected by the {entity} import.

profile.messageSaveError: The profile could not be saved.
profile.messageDeleteError: The profile could not be saved. Please make sure that all logs for this profile are deleted.
profile.messageDuplicateError: The profile could not be duplicated.
profile.messageCsvTemplateUploadEmptyError: CSV file does not contain any columns.
profile.messageCsvTemplateUploadWarning: Imported mapping may be incorrect. CSV file only contains one column. Check CSV separator setting.
profile.addNewProfileTooltipLanguage: Profiles can only be created in the default system language
profile.addMappingTooltipText: Please define an object type first.
profile.objectTypeFieldTooltipText: The object type cannot be changed when mapping options are present.
profile.descriptionBlock: Object types define a certain mode for importing and exporting data. Selecting an object type will limit the mapping options. Notice that you cannot change the object type after mapping options have been introduced.
profile.mappingDescriptionBlock: Use the table on the "Mappings" tab to map CSV fields to their respective database counterparts.
profile.csvDescriptionBlock: Separators and enclosure characters are used to indicate the separate field within the CSV file. Separators are used to split single fields, enclosure characters are used to group multiple fields.
profile.systemDefaultInfoText: You are viewing a system default profile which cannot be modified. You can either create a new profile or duplicate a system default profile.
profile.mappingAutomatedDescription: Shopware mapped {automatedCount} database entries to the database automatically. Please map the missing entries to the correct database entry. Empty required fields will cause an error during the import unless a default value has been set. Default values will be used to fill empty database entries for imports.
profile.mappingDescription: Use the table below to map the CSV column names to Shopware database entries. Empty required fields will cause an error during the import unless a default value has been set.
profile.violationMessage: Your profile is not valid, yet. You need to add mappings to the required fields shown below to save the profile:
profile.profileTypeDisabledText: Clear 'object type' in order to be able to select any 'usage'.
profile.objectTypeDisabledText: Clear 'usage' in order to be able to select any 'object type'.
profile.csvUploadText: Create mapping from an existing CSV file.

exporter.exportActivityDescription: Activities older than 30 days will be removed automatically.
exporter.variantsWarning: Warning: Make sure that the properties and variants linked to the products in the exported CSV file are available in the new system. If this is not the case, you have the possibility to export properties and variants as single CSV files with corresponding profiles. If you do not have both cases, you have to create the product variants manually in the new system after the export.

importer.messageImportError: There were errors during the import of "{profile}"
importer.messageImportWarning: No records imported. Please make sure your delimiters match the current profile.
importer.warningBlock: Warning: Make sure that the properties and variants linked to the products in your uploaded CSV file are available in the shop. If this is not the case, you have the possibility to import properties and variants as single CSV files with corresponding profiles. If you do not have both cases, you have to maintain the product variants manually in the product module after the import.
importer.labelUploadCaption: Select a CSV file to upload
importer.variantsWarning:
Attention when importing variants: If the variants are to be imported completely directly, you should also import them. Use a profile that imports variant settings.
If you don't do this, the variants must be created manually by the admin.
